metadata: (info { (description "Yasasukari Musashi (\"The soldiers' eight-way hunt\") is a hunt game played in Japan during the eighteenth century. ") (rules "5x5 intersecting lines, with diagonals drawn in the quadrants. One player plays as a single piece, which begins in the central spot of the board. The Other player plays as sixteen pieces, placed on the spots along the perimeter of the board.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "962") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/hunt/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Japan, around 1712.") } )
